title: Glories of Sudarshana Chakra Weapon of Krishna | Sri Madhava Hari Dasa | SB 1.18.30 | 14.07.2024
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.key_quote: It so happened by the will of the lord.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the context of Parikshit Maharaj's actions and attributes them to the will of the Lord.

segments.key_quote: This is the law of reception.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the importance of proper reception, even to enemies, contrasting it with the cold treatment Parikshit Maharaj received.

segments.key_quote: Eventually, we will see that the Parikshit was cursed by a sage.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Parikshit Maharaj's anger and its consequences, linking it to the will of the Lord and setting the stage for the recitation of Srimad Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: When his desire is not fulfilled, immediately there is anger.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the concept of free will, its misuse, and how unfulfilled desires lead to anger, connecting it to Krishna's teachings in the Bhagavad Gita.

segments.key_quote: He compared this opulence to an insignificant piece of a stone.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the story of Ambarish Maharaj, highlighting his detachment from material opulence despite being a powerful king.
The speaker shares a personal anecdote about someone who forgot God after being blessed with opulence, illustrating the dangers of attachment and sense gratification.

segments.key_quote: But still they were remembering the Lord in all circumstances.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the Pandavas' devotion amidst adversity with the previous example, emphasizing the importance of remembering God in all situations.

segments.key_quote: How he remembered the Lord always?
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Ambarish Maharaj constantly remembered the Lord by engaging all his senses in devotional service.

segments.key_quote: He was completely attached to me.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Krishna from the Bhagavad Gita, emphasizing the importance of attachment to Krishna and working in Krishna consciousness, then transitions to discussing Ambarish Maharaj observing Ekadasi vrata.

segments.key_quote: He gives sixty crores of cows as charity to the brahmanas.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Ambarish Maharaj's elaborate preparations for breaking his Ekadasi fast, including giving immense charity to the brahmanas.
The speaker narrates the arrival of Durvasa Muni and the dilemma faced by Ambarish Maharaj, leading to Durvasa Muni's anger and perceived offense.

segments.key_quote: A devotee cannot be defeated by so called mystic yogi.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that a devotee possesses all good qualities and cannot be defeated by mystic power, describing Durvasa Muni's anger and the creation of a demon, but Ambarish Maharaj remains undisturbed.
